Amy Bogard
Artist & Educator
September 28, 2010, Amy reported directly to Diana

It is not often that one person can carry both desirable characteristics of 'business person' (excellent communicator, detail oriented, stringent with company budget, proficient in computer skills) and 'creative person' (excellent design sense, visionary, creative problem solver, motivator).  Diana Wood is one such person.  I worked as a professional puppeteer for Diana at the Red Cross as part of that organization's Health and Safety programming.  She single-handedly created programming which furthered the Red Cross outreach mission in ways not seen at other branches of the American Red Cross.  Instead of average in-school programming that many school children are used to, Diana worked with artists in the region to create fun and unforgettable puppet shows that embodied the crucial safety and prevention messages inherent to the Red Cross mission.  It was a pleasure to work with and for Diana Wood.  Her constant good nature and capacity to wear many hats in her job made my job that much easier.  She is capable of talking numbers (programming budgets, employee hours, insurance, mileage) one moment and crafting innovative ideas (new show ideas, creative ways to improve current shows) the next.  Employees such as Diana are key to success in the way businesses will operate in the future.  Creative, innovative thinking and problem solving combined with an inherent business sense will be key to a successful business practice.  If your company is thinking of hiring Diana Wood, DO SO!  She is wonderful to work with and I have learned so much from her in my years of working with her.  Thank you,Amy BogardCincinnati, Ohio

Paula McIntosh
American Red Cross, Chief Community Presence Officer, Retired
September 15, 2010, Paula managed Diana directly

I hired Diana into the Red Cross in 1987 and am still congratulating myself on that decision. Diana has been a productive, creative and highly dedicated Red Cross employee for many years.  She has proven herself in a variety of roles:  as a trainer and designer of training programs, as a presenter/speaker for any type of audience, as a promoter and believer in the value of volunteers, as an advocate for the importance of disaster preparedness for children and families, and in other ways too numerous to mention. Diana is a person who puts her commitments and beliefs into action and who genuinely wants to share the Red Cross mission with everyone she touches.

September 14, 2015, Diana worked with Bobby but at different companies

I put Bobby in the category of professionals who just ooze passion for their work. summary: Creative communicator, able to bring my extensive experience in in program development and training to bear to create and deliver programs of excellence which advance an organization's mission and goals.Skill Highlights: Excellent public speaker, superior writing skills, works well one-on-one and with groups: developing creativity and motivating them, excels in organization and logistics, confident, high degree of initiative.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Internet.Specialties: Bringing positive and creative energy to training, program development, community outreach, working with volunteers, working with high school and college student groups.
